storyInfo: Rookie operator Myrrh deals with an old woman who refuses treatment, finding that her job involves far more than just healing.

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Ursus Outpost
*Yawn*... Morning meeting after hitting the hay at four last night? Gimme a break...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Why don't you look tired at all, Sussurro?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We were taught at school to put on a proper appearance at work, so—
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: So you had three cups of espresso first thing in the morning. Not exactly a healthy lifestyle, Operator Sussurro.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Ahem. Now that Hibiscus is here, let's start the meeting.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Wait, before that we need to introduce our newest colleague. Come on in, Operator Myrrh.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: G-Good morning. I'm Myrrh, and I've just been made an operator. You can also call me by my real name, Adelaide.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: She's been assigned to us after completing her internship. Operator Myrrh, meet Operator Gavial.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Good morning, Miss Gavial.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Just call me Gavial.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Glad to have you onboard. We can always use more medics. Can't even remember the last time I got a good night's sleep.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We're doing what we can to recruit more. Just try not to scare away the rookies before they even get settled in.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I-I'm ready for it. Dr. Kal'tsit told me that the job of a medic is really tough.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Good to hear you've gotten advance warning. Things are really hectic around here.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That's Operator Sussurro next to Gavial. She'll be your supervisor.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: G-Good morning, Miss Sussurro. I look forward to working with you.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Right. Just so you know, us operators don't really call each other 'Miss'. And don't worry, we'll ease you in gradually.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: I-I'll do my best. Please let me know whenever I'm doing something wrong.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Seriously, we're just thankful to have you here to take on some of the workload.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Ahem. Then shall we get to today's schedule?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: The refugees' conditions are all under control on my end. If all goes well, we should be able to release some of them by next month.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What about you, Hibiscus?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Most of the patients are fine, except for one.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Who's that?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Mrs. Luba.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Is she doing badly?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Her condition isn't all that bad, but she's been refusing treatment.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Wait. She's sick, but doesn't want to get treated?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: She's a superstitious one. When she first came, she told me not to waste my time because her village shaman told her she wouldn't live past seventy.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Seems a little dodgy...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: She believes every word of it, though, even seeing everyday events as signs that the end is near.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: She practically fled when she saw Biggie outside last Friday.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Apparently, seeing a black Originium slug is an omen that death approaches.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: So that's why she was crying all day. Wouldn't even take her meals.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: (Whisper) Maybe...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It's just a tough situation all around.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Excuse me, Sussurro? May I try talking to her?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Are you sure? It takes more than medical expertise to work with a patient like her. You need communication skills too.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: There are many superstitious people where I'm from, and I've picked up a few tricks to deal with them.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Are you sure about this?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Why not let her have a go? Not like we've got any better ideas.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: P-Please. I want to do this.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Very well then, give it a shot. Gavial, could you bring up Mrs. Luba's patient history for her?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Thank you, Gavial.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Are we sure about this, Sussurro? I still think we should think it through.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Gavial's right though, we don't have any other ideas.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Be sure to report back if you encounter any trouble with her. We'll do what we can to support you.
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Thank you. I'll do my best.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Welp, then follow me, Myrrh.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Was there anything else you wanted to say, Hibiscus?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Er, well, I'm still a little worried. Dr. Kal'tsit told me about some of her... quirks.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Such as?
attributes.name: Sussurro

attributes.content: Let's just say that she has some superstitions of her own.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Field Hospital
Mrs. Luba should be here...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Enough! Take it away! I don't need it.
Excuse me, what's going on in there? She sounded angry.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Ah, you must be the new doctor.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I spilled a jar of salt. Apparently that's a taboo in Ursus, like it's really unlucky for them, so she's fuming mad.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Maybe you should come back later, let her get it out of her system.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'm just here to say hi.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I said I don't need it! What are y— Oh.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Good morning, Mrs. Luba.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: And who are you?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: My name is Myrrh, and I'm your new doctor. I'll be working with you to treat your symptoms—
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Get out, girl, and take your medicine with you! Stop wasting your time on me and let me go in peace!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Well, Mrs. Luba, I, er, didn't bring any medicine today.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Then what are you here for? Trying to talk me out of my 'superstitions' again?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: No, not at all. I've never been very good at talking.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Then, what? You here to gawk?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Well, I, er, brought something for you. It's a lucky charm from home that I've been carrying for years. My clan chief told me that it brings good luck to whoever wears it.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: (Takes the charm from her neck and gives it to the old woman)
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Sorry if it's a little worn.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: A little thing like this... Well, thank you anyway.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: It's gotten me out of trouble so many times over the years.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I didn't think you young folk believed in these things anymore. Everyone's always on about 'science' and 'evidence' and that only backwards, uneducated folk like me still believe this stuff.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: People always tell me that I'm superstitious too. I always go into a room with my left foot first, and the first thing I do when I move to a new place is set up some fowlbeast feathers.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I'm a little afraid to even talk about these things with my peers. Many of them graduated from med school, and they just sneer at this stuff.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: They're too young to believe in fate. When you get to my age, you realize that some things that are just out of the hands of us mortals.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: When I was little, a fortune teller said I was fated for hardship for the rest of my life.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I didn't believe it back then, but look at me now.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: My village got caught up in a Catastrophe, my only daughter's dead from it, and now I'm sick in my old age. I'm not long for this world.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Oh, Mika... How could you leave your mother all alone like this?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: (Takes the old woman's hands) Mrs. Luba...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: What is it? Bored with my griping?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: No, not at all. I want to know more. Tell me about your daughter. Considering how well you've aged, your daughter must have been truly beautiful.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: And here you said you weren't any good at talking.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Right, my Mika was the jewel of the village. Her golden hair was like silk, so smooth and shiny.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Oh, my poor girl... life means nothing without her.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Everything tastes so bland these days. And each day is just about making it to the next one.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Would you like some sour apple pie?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Where's this coming from? What is it anyway?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: It's a new item on the canteen menu. The tangy flavor really works up the appetite.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I'm not hungry. Just stay and chat with me for a bit.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Go on then, I'm listening.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Mika always loved apples. Not the sweet ones, but the sour ones.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I could never handle anything too sour. It makes my teeth curl.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: My Mika always had such great teeth...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: The air outside smells so fresh after last night's snow, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Stopping by so early? Don't you have work to do?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Don't worry, my schedule isn't that packed.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: You doctors always seem so busy. Didn't think you'd have time to listen to me babble.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Hehe, would you rather I didn't come then?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Girl...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: To be honest, it's good to see you.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I feel the same way. I couldn't stop thinking about you.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Why? What do you see in a washed-up old woman like me?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You're about my grandma's age, and you even look a little alike. Seeing you reminds me of her.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: If I had a granddaughter, she'd be about your age now.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You must've really loved your grandma then.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Yes. She taught me everything I know about wild forest herbs, and how to use them for medicine.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: She also taught me how to find my way, so I'm never lost no matter where I go.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Do you miss home?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Very much.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Me too... but I won't see it again. And I won't ever see my Mika either.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Don't cry, Mrs. Luba. She'll come back to you, someday.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: What are you on about? How can somebody who's dead come back to me?!
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Please, don't get angry. It's just what we say in my clan.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: We believe that the spirit of the woods guides the dead to the Great Green, where they become one with nature.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Whenever someone in my clan dies, we gather by the river and send down a little boat holding a candle, in order to light the way back for them.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Even if what you said is true, and Mika really came back... what would she become?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I don't know. Maybe the stars and the wind in the sky, or the snow and the rain on a lake.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Or the grass under our feet, soft and lovely...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: But the land's so big. How could I find her?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: We... we can't find them ourselves. We can only wait for them to find us.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That's why our chief leads the guiding dance at funerals, so that those who are gone can find their way back and reunite with us.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Girl...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Do you... know the dance? Can you dance for her? For Mika?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I want to see her. No matter what she's become.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Myrrh did not know how bad her dancing was.
Her steps were slow and out of sync with her arms. Even a farmer tilling the fields would look more elegant and coordinated.
Her movements were clumsy and comical, like a baby fowlbeast flailing in the snow.
But Luba did not laugh. As Myrrh made circles in the snow, waving her arms, a cold morning wind brushed against the hair on Luba's brow.
She closed her eyes and felt the air rush past her cheek. Something warm filled her eyes.
Girl...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: (Falls) T-The world's spinning... I'm spinning...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Mrs. Luba? W-What is it?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Let's go back. I'm in the mood for some sour apple pie.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: One month later...
There you are, Adelaide. Good to see you one last time before I leave.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Your symptoms are under control, and should remain stable for the foreseeable future. As long as you watch your diet and take the suppressant regularly.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Thank you so much for doing all this for an old sack of bones like me.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I'm just doing my job. Oh, before I forget... here, I got you a sour apple pie to eat on the way.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Aw, aren't you just a sweetheart? You remember my favorite.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I'll see you off then.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Sure thing, love.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Before I came here, I was all outta hope. I would just sit on my bed all day, wishing to kick the bucket already.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Until I met you.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Now I can feel Mika by my side all the time. I see her whenever I look at the mountains, the trees, the flowers, the grass, the rain, the snow...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I want to see more, to keep seeing her.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: And to do that, I've gotta keep on living.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I'm sure she'd be happy. Take care, Mrs. Luba. I'm not sure how often we can see each other again...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Come now, pull yourself together.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Myrrh smiles and takes the old woman's hand. The two of them walk quietly over the snow.
Only when they have arrived at the village gate does the old woman hesitantly begin to speak.
Adelaide... let me ask you something. Answer me honestly.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: All that stuff you told me... is it really true?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Mrs. Luba...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I mean, do you believe it? Be honest.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: When I was little, the chief would brew me medicine whenever I was sick. And I always got better soon after taking it.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I used to think it was so amazing.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: But when I came to the landship, I began to study its composition, to learn medicine in a systematic matter.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That's when I found that it was just a common herbal drink, with no special effects.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: So I put away my research on it, and turned to studying other medicines.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: But I still find myself making it whenever I get sick, simply out of habit.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: And not just when I'm sick - I do it when an experiment didn't go well, or when I can't sleep, or when I scrape my knee after a fall.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Why do you keep drinking it, even though you know it has no effect?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I'm not sure why... sorry.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Why... why, indeed?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Is it all true, Harmonia? Does this dance really bring the dead back to our side? Does the Great Green really exist?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Adelaide... I can't answer that question, because I don't know either.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: Why do you join the chief in the guiding dance then, if you don't know sure?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Because I hope that it's true, and that someday we'll reunite with the ones who have left us.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: That's why I dance.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: This land has too many troubles and hardships. The helpless must learn to help themselves, and the lost must learn to find their own answers.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: That's why we place our hopes on the ethereal, on the supernatural.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: That's why we have superstitions.
attributes.name: Harmonia

attributes.content: But, Harmonia...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I suppose it becomes true if you believe in it.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Never mind. Who cares if it's true or not, at my age?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: There isn't much I can give you, but take this necklace that my man left me.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: No, I can't accept that.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Just take it. It's nothing valuable.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I appreciate it, but the Medical Department has rules against accepting gifts from patients.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: It'll bring you good luck. Take it, girl, and take care.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: As she watches Mrs. Luba leave, Adelaide rubs her eyes and recalls sitting by Harmonia, gazing at the river in the distance.

attributes.text: That night, the canopy was bathed in the silver light of the twin moons, shining through the gaps in the leaves.
The night wind carried the wailing of the clanspeople as they pushed floating candles into the river one after another.
Their light brightened the night sky, forming a band of radiance embracing the people gathered on the bank.
